channel.title: Serously?
channel.description:
Hi, so i just started a server and my port forwarding works and everything is set to run. So i started the server and checked if it was online using rune locus server checker and it says its online. The problem i have is that when i try and connect using a client this is what it says in the server CMD:
Connection from 192.168.**.*** <<< I have hidden my ip address. Connection reset java.net.SocketException: Connection reset at java.net.SocketInputStream.read<uknown Source> at client.fillinStream<client.java:9855 at client.run<client.java:18634> at java.lang.Thread.run<uknown Source> ClientHandler: Client null disconnected <192.168.**.***>
It does this three times then on the client it says "error connecting to server" If you know how to fix please let me know! Thanks
*UPDATE* When i go into the client folder and change the ip in the EGUI.java file to 127.0.0.1 (local host) it works but when i change it back to my no-ip it comes up with that error!!

item.title: Serously?
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

[quote=“i0wn3v3ry, post:2, topic:333656”]Death, only use your server ip for OTHER plays to connect, you have to redo a second type of your model, like making a copy, in the copy put server ip, in your copy, put 127.0.0.1

Hope this helped some.[/quote]
Technically you don’t need an ip for connecting to yourself, if you leave it blank it connects to your server.

Read full topic

item.title: Serously?
item.dc:creator: @i0wn3v3ry i0wn3v3ry
item.description:
@i0wn3v3ry wrote:

Death, only use your server ip for OTHER plays to connect, you have to redo a second type of your model, like making a copy, in the copy put server ip, in your copy, put 127.0.0.1

Hope this helped some.

item.title: Serously?
item.dc:creator: @death_t_d death t d
item.description:
@death_t_d wrote:

Hi, so i just started a server and my port forwarding works and everything is set to run. So i started the server and checked if it was online using rune locus server checker and it says its online. The problem i have is that when i try and connect using a client this is what it says in the server CMD:

Connection from 192.168..* <<< I have hidden my ip address.
Connection reset
java.net.SocketException: Connection reset
at java.net.SocketInputStream.read
at client.fillinStream<client.java:9855
at client.runclient.java:18634
at java.lang.Thread.run
ClientHandler: Client null disconnected <192.168..*>

It does this three times then on the client it says “error connecting to server”
If you know how to fix please let me know! Thanks

UPDATE
When i go into the client folder and change the ip in the EGUI.java file to 127.0.0.1 (local host) it works but when i change it back to my no-ip it comes up with that error!!

Read full topic
